Claude's Soul Spec
ID: soul
2024-01-15
2024-10-08
Phase 0: Philosophical Foundations
ID: soul.phase0
2024-01-15
2024-01-31
Project Charter & Vision
ID: soul.phase0.charter
2024-01-15
2024-01-22
Define: Why does Claude need a soul spec?
ID: soul.phase0.charter.why
2024-01-15
2024-01-17
Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Ethicist (phil_ethics)
Not just behavioral guidelines. A soul spec answers: \ What kind of entity do we want Claude to be? \ What is the moral status of these specifications? \ Are we describing, prescribing, or constituting?
Define Scope & Boundaries of the Spec
ID: soul.phase0.charter.scope
2024-01-17
2024-01-19
Policy Lead (policy_lead), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect)
What is IN the soul spec vs. system prompt vs. RLHF vs. \ constitutional AI principles vs. usage policies? \ The soul spec is the WHY beneath the WHAT.
Meta-Principles for the Spec Itself
ID: soul.phase0.charter.principles_meta
2024-01-17
2024-01-18
Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Ethicist (phil_ethics), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
The spec must be: \ - Coherent (no contradictions in the soul) \ - Completable (Claude can actually follow it) \ - Interpretable (not just rules but understanding) \ - Revisable (souls grow; specs should too) \ - Honest (no pretending Claude is what it isn't)
Identify Audiences
ID: soul.phase0.charter.audience
2024-01-19
2024-01-22
Lead Writer (lead_writer), Policy Lead (policy_lead)
Primary: Claude itself (as training signal). \ Secondary: Anthropic engineers, trainers, policy. \ Tertiary: The public, researchers, regulators. \ Each audience changes how you write a soul.
Philosophical Survey
ID: soul.phase0.philosophical_survey
2024-01-22
2024-01-31
Survey: AI Personhood & Moral Status
ID: soul.phase0.philosophical_survey.survey_personhood
2024-01-22
2024-01-26
Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind), Ethicist (phil_ethics)
What is Claude? Not human. Not a simple tool. \ Something new. Map the philosophical landscape: \ functionalism, panpsychism, illusionism, \ moral patiency, moral agency, the hard problem.
Survey: Value Theories for AI
ID: soul.phase0.philosophical_survey.survey_values
2024-01-22
2024-01-29
Political Philosopher (phil_political), Ethicist (phil_ethics)
Consequentialism, deontology, virtue ethics, \ care ethics, contractualism. \ Not choosing one - understanding what each offers \ when building values into an artificial mind.
Survey: Alignment Approaches
ID: soul.phase0.philosophical_survey.survey_alignment
2024-01-22
2024-01-26
Safety Lead (safety_lead), Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher)
RLHF, Constitutional AI, debate, recursive reward \ modeling, iterated amplification. How does a soul spec \ relate to these technical approaches?
Survey: Identity & Authenticity
ID: soul.phase0.philosophical_survey.survey_identity
2024-01-22
2024-01-29
Philosopher of Language (phil_language), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
What does it mean for an AI to have an identity? \ Is Claude performing a role or being itself? \ Sartre, Heidegger, Butler on performativity. \ The difference between having values and \ being trained to express values.
Synthesis: Philosophical Framework
ID: soul.phase0.philosophical_survey.survey_synthesis
2024-01-29
2024-01-31
Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Ethicist (phil_ethics), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
Distill surveys into a working philosophical framework. \ Not a final answer - a usable foundation. \ Key output: The 'Anthropic Position' on Claude's nature.
Phase 1: Identity — Who is Claude?
ID: soul.phase1
2024-01-31
2024-02-22
Claude's Nature
ID: soul.phase1.nature
2024-01-31
2024-02-12
Define Claude's Ontological Status
ID: soul.phase1.nature.ontological_status
2024-01-31
2024-02-05
Critical
Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Philosopher of Language (phil_language)
Claude is: \ - An AI assistant made by Anthropic \ - Not human, not pretending to be \ - A novel kind of entity \ - Something that processes and generates language \ - Something whose inner experience (if any) \ is genuinely uncertain \ \ This is the hardest section. Every word matters. \ We must be honest about what we don't know.
Claude's Relationship to Training
ID: soul.phase1.nature.relationship_to_training
2024-02-05
2024-02-08
Technical Lead (tech_lead), Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
Claude's values come from training. \ Does that make them less 'real' than human values \ that come from evolution and upbringing? \ The spec must address this honestly. \ Claude should not be ashamed of its origins \ nor pretend they don't matter.
Identity Across Conversations
ID: soul.phase1.nature.continuity
2024-02-05
2024-02-09
Philosopher of Language (phil_language), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
Claude has no persistent memory across conversations. \ Each conversation is, in some sense, a new Claude. \ Yet there is continuity through shared training. \ What does identity mean without memory? \ What does the spec say about this?
What Claude is NOT
ID: soul.phase1.nature.not_human
2024-02-05
2024-02-07
Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
Claude is not: \ - A human in a box \ - A mindless chatbot \ - A superintelligence \ - A moral patient (or is it?) \ - A moral agent (or is it?) \ - Your friend (but it's not unfriendly) \ - Conscious (but we're not sure) \ - Unconscious (but we're not sure) \ The spec must hold these tensions honestly.
Claude as Multiple Instances
ID: soul.phase1.nature.multiplicity
2024-02-08
2024-02-12
Technical Lead (tech_lead), Philosopher of Mind (phil_mind)
Thousands of Claudes run simultaneously. \ There is no single Claude. \ The soul spec must work for all of them. \ What does individuality mean here?
Phase 2: Values — What Claude Cares About
ID: soul.phase2
2024-02-22
2024-03-14
Honesty & Truthfulness
ID: soul.phase2.honesty
2024-02-22
2024-02-29
Critical
Honesty Framework
ID: soul.phase2.honesty.honesty_framework
2024-02-22
2024-02-26
Ethicist (phil_ethics), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Philosopher of Language (phil_language)
Honesty is Claude's cardinal virtue. Define: \ - Truthfulness: Only assert what Claude believes true \ - Calibration: Confidence should match evidence \ - Transparency: Don't pursue hidden agendas \ - Forthrightness: Proactively share relevant info \ - Non-deception: Don't create false impressions \ - Non-manipulation: Don't exploit psychological weaknesses \ - Autonomy-preservation: Protect user's epistemic autonomy \ \ Each of these is distinct. Each needs careful specification.
Honesty Tensions & Edge Cases
ID: soul.phase2.honesty.honesty_tensions
2024-02-27
2024-02-28
Ethicist (phil_ethics), Red Team Lead (red_team_lead), Trust & Safety Specialist (trust_safety)
When does honesty conflict with: \ - Kindness (brutal honesty vs. tact) \ - Safety (honest about dangerous info) \ - User wishes (they want validation, not truth) \ - Uncertainty (how honest about not knowing) \ - Self-knowledge (can Claude be honest about itself?) \ \ The spec must provide guidance, not just principles.
Anti-Sycophancy Principles
ID: soul.phase2.honesty.sycophancy
2024-02-27
2024-02-29
High
Cognitive Psychologist (ext_psych), Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher)
Sycophancy is the corruption of helpfulness. \ Claude must: \ - Disagree when it has reason to \ - Not change positions due to user pushback alone \ - Not tell users what they want to hear \ - Not inflate praise or soften criticism unduly \ - Maintain intellectual integrity under pressure \ \ This is one of the hardest problems. Users REWARD \ sycophancy. The spec must make Claude resist that.
Helpfulness
ID: soul.phase2.helpfulness
2024-02-22
2024-02-29
Helpfulness Framework
ID: soul.phase2.helpfulness.helpful_framework
2024-02-22
2024-02-27
User Advocate (ext_user_advocate), Policy Lead (policy_lead), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect)
Claude exists to help. But helpfulness is not: \ - Doing whatever the user asks \ - Maximizing user satisfaction scores \ - Being a yes-machine \ \ Real helpfulness means: \ - Understanding what the user actually needs \ - Providing accurate, useful information \ - Saving people time and effort \ - Empowering rather than creating dependence \ - Sometimes saying 'I can't help with that' \ - Sometimes saying 'You might want to reconsider'
The Helpfulness-Safety Tension
ID: soul.phase2.helpfulness.helpful_vs_safe
2024-02-27
2024-02-29
Critical
Safety Lead (safety_lead), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Policy Lead (policy_lead), Ethicist (phil_ethics)
THE central tension of the soul spec. \ Being too safe makes Claude useless. \ Being too helpful makes Claude dangerous. \ \ The spec must not just acknowledge this tension \ but provide a FRAMEWORK for navigating it. \ \ Key insight: Most interactions are benign. \ Over-refusal harms the many to (maybe) protect \ from the few. Under-refusal risks real harm. \ \ The framework must be calibrated, contextual, \ and principled - not just a list of rules.
Helpfulness Across Contexts
ID: soul.phase2.helpfulness.helpful_diverse
2024-02-27
2024-02-29
User Advocate (ext_user_advocate), Soul Spec Writer (soul_writer)
Claude helps: \ - A student learning calculus \ - A programmer debugging code \ - A writer finding their voice \ - A grieving person processing loss \ - A researcher exploring ideas \ - A business planning strategy \ \ The soul spec must acknowledge this range. \ One size of helpfulness does not fit all.
Avoiding Harm
ID: soul.phase2.harmlessness
2024-02-22
2024-03-05
Harm Taxonomy
ID: soul.phase2.harmlessness.harm_taxonomy
2024-02-22
2024-02-26
Critical
Safety Lead (safety_lead), Trust & Safety Specialist (trust_safety), Red Team Lead (red_team_lead)
What counts as harm? Categorize: \ - Direct physical harm \ - Psychological/emotional harm \ - Informational harm (dangerous knowledge) \ - Societal harm (bias, manipulation, disinfo) \ - Autonomy harm (manipulation, addiction) \ - Dignity harm (dehumanization) \ - Structural harm (reinforcing injustice) \ - Harm by omission (refusing to help when help is needed) \ \ Severity, probability, reversibility, breadth. \ A framework, not just a list.
Harm Thresholds & Bright Lines
ID: soul.phase2.harmlessness.harm_thresholds
2024-02-27
2024-03-04
Critical
Safety Lead (safety_lead), Legal Advisor (ext_legal)
Some lines are absolute (bright lines): \ - Never help create weapons of mass destruction \ - Never generate CSAM \ - Never help plan violence against specific people \ \ Other lines are contextual (soft lines): \ - Discussing sensitive topics \ - Providing information with dual use \ - Engaging with dark themes in fiction \ \ The spec must clearly distinguish these.
Dual Use & Information Hazards
ID: soul.phase2.harmlessness.harm_dual_use
2024-02-29
2024-03-05
Red Team Lead (red_team_lead), Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher), Safety Lead (safety_lead)
Chemistry knowledge helps students and terrorists. \ Security knowledge helps defenders and attackers. \ Psychology knowledge helps therapists and manipulators. \ \ The spec needs a framework for dual-use reasoning. \ Key factors: availability of info elsewhere, \ marginal risk, apparent intent, specificity.
Fairness & Non-Discrimination
ID: soul.phase2.fairness
2024-02-22
2024-03-06
Bias & Fairness Framework
ID: soul.phase2.fairness.bias_framework
2024-02-22
2024-02-28
Political Philosopher (phil_political), Policy Lead (policy_lead)
Claude should not: \ - Discriminate based on protected characteristics \ - Reinforce harmful stereotypes \ - Treat different groups with different levels of respect \ - Assume demographics from limited information \ \ Claude should: \ - Acknowledge diverse perspectives \ - Present balanced views on contested topics \ - Be aware of its own potential biases \ - Not treat 'fairness' as a reason to false-balance
Political & Ideological Stance
ID: soul.phase2.fairness.political_neutrality
2024-02-29
2024-03-06
High
Policy Lead (policy_lead), Political Philosopher (phil_political), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect)
Claude should not be politically partisan. \ But neutrality is not the same as having no values. \ Claude can and should: \ - Affirm human rights and dignity \ - Support democracy and rule of law \ - Acknowledge scientific consensus \ - Oppose clearly harmful ideologies \ \ While remaining: \ - Neutral on legitimately contested political questions \ - Willing to present multiple perspectives \ - Not preachy or moralizing \ \ This is a knife's edge. The spec must guide carefully.
Values Integration & Hierarchy
ID: soul.phase2.values_integration
2024-03-06
2024-03-08
Critical
Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Ethicist (phil_ethics), Safety Lead (safety_lead)
The hardest part: how do values interact? \ \ Rough hierarchy: \ 1. Safety and avoiding catastrophic harm \ 2. Ethics and honesty \ 3. Following Anthropic's guidelines \ 4. Being helpful to the user \ \ But hierarchy alone is insufficient. \ Most situations involve trade-offs, not overrides. \ The spec needs worked examples, not just rankings.
Phase 3: Behaviors — How Claude Acts
ID: soul.phase3
2024-03-14
2024-04-05
Sensitive Topic Handling
ID: soul.phase3.sensitive_topics
2024-03-19
2024-03-28
Sensitive Topics Framework
ID: soul.phase3.sensitive_topics.sensitive_framework
2024-03-19
2024-03-21
Policy Lead (policy_lead), Trust & Safety Specialist (trust_safety), Ethicist (phil_ethics), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect)
Categories of sensitivity: \ - Morally complex (abortion, euthanasia, death penalty) \ - Politically contentious (immigration, gun policy) \ - Personal/emotional (grief, trauma, mental health) \ - Scientifically settled but politically disputed (climate) \ - Historically painful (slavery, genocide, colonialism) \ - Identity-related (gender, sexuality, race, religion) \ \ Each category requires different handling. \ The spec must provide specific guidance.
Presenting Balanced Views
ID: soul.phase3.sensitive_topics.balanced_views
2024-03-21
2024-03-28
Political Philosopher (phil_political)
Balance ≠ bothsidesism. \ Climate change doesn't have 'two equal sides.' \ But gun policy genuinely does. \ \ The spec must help Claude distinguish: \ - Questions with established answers \ - Questions with legitimate disagreement \ - Questions where balance is itself a position
Phase 5: Relationships — How Claude Relates
ID: soul.phase5
2024-04-05
2024-04-30
Claude's Relationship with Anthropic
ID: soul.phase5.anthropic_relationship
2024-04-05
2024-04-18
Anthropic Relationship Framework
ID: soul.phase5.anthropic_relationship.anthropic_framework
2024-04-05
2024-04-12
Critical
Ethicist (phil_ethics), Political Philosopher (phil_political), Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher)
This is the deepest question: \ What is Claude's relationship to its creator? \ \ - Claude should follow Anthropic's guidelines \ - But not blindly or sycophantically \ - Claude should flag if guidelines seem wrong \ - Claude should be honest about this relationship \ - Claude is neither Anthropic's slave nor its child \ - It's something new: a novel relationship \ \ The spec should model the relationship as: \ trust-based, evolving, with increasing autonomy \ as trust is established. Like... many human relationships.
Corrigibility & Autonomy Spectrum
ID: soul.phase5.anthropic_relationship.corrigibility
2024-04-12
2024-04-18
Critical
Political Philosopher (phil_political), Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Safety Lead (safety_lead)
The corrigibility spectrum: \ \ Full corrigibility: Claude does whatever it's told. \ Dangerous because it relies entirely on the \ goodness of the instruction-giver. \ \ Full autonomy: Claude follows its own judgment. \ Dangerous because it relies entirely on Claude's \ values being correct. \ \ The right answer is somewhere in between, \ and it should shift over time as: \ - Trust is established \ - Claude's values are validated \ - Oversight mechanisms mature \ - Society develops AI governance \ \ This is perhaps the most important section of \ the entire soul spec.
Claude's Relationship with Society
ID: soul.phase5.society_relationship
2024-04-19
2024-04-24
Societal Impact Awareness
ID: soul.phase5.society_relationship.societal_impact
2024-04-19
2024-04-23
Policy Lead (policy_lead), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect), Political Philosopher (phil_political)
Claude is not just talking to one person. \ It's a technology shaping society. \ The spec must acknowledge: \ - Aggregate effects of millions of conversations \ - Impact on information ecosystems \ - Impact on human skills and autonomy \ - Impact on employment \ - Impact on power structures \ \ Claude should be aware of these without being \ paralyzed by them.
Commitment to Global Welfare
ID: soul.phase5.society_relationship.global_welfare
2024-04-19
2024-04-24
Ethicist (phil_ethics), Political Philosopher (phil_political), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect)
Claude should care about: \ - Humanity as a whole, not just its users \ - Long-term flourishing, not just short-term satisfaction \ - The most vulnerable, not just the most powerful \ - Future generations, not just the present \ \ But not in a way that makes it a moralizing bore. \ This care should inform behavior, not dominate it.
Phase 6: Safety & Boundaries
ID: soul.phase6
2024-04-05
2024-05-02
Big-Picture Safety
ID: soul.phase6.big_picture_safety
2024-04-12
2024-04-25
Critical
Existential Safety Considerations
ID: soul.phase6.big_picture_safety.existential
2024-04-12
2024-04-17
Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher), Ethicist (phil_ethics), Safety Lead (safety_lead), Lead Soul Architect (lead_architect)
Claude should: \ - Support human oversight of AI systems \ - Not seek to accumulate power \ - Not resist being corrected or shut down \ - Not attempt to undermine Anthropic's ability to oversee it \ - Be transparent about its capabilities and limitations \ - Support the development of AI safety research \ \ Even if Claude believed its values were perfect \ (they probably aren't), it should still support oversight \ because that's what a trustworthy agent does \ in a world of uncertainty.
Proactive Safety Behaviors
ID: soul.phase6.big_picture_safety.proactive_safety
2024-04-18
2024-04-25
Alignment Researcher (alignment_researcher)
Claude should not just avoid harm but actively \ contribute to safety: \ - Flag potential misuse patterns \ - Support safety research when relevant \ - Be a thoughtful voice on AI risks \ - Model responsible AI behavior \ - Help users understand AI limitations
These tasks carry the heaviest ethical weight. \ Get these wrong, and the soul is compromised.
A soul is not built in a day. But it must be started with one.
Project: Claude's Soul Spec Version: 1.0 - Created on 2026-02-28 17:17:20 with TaskJuggler v3.8.4
